Peter, that is indeed very interesting about the "mexican wave" still 
work=
ing with increasted numbers of hidden nodes.  The benefits of 
that kind of=
 consistency could turn out quite useful in the future.

About your idea re=
garding a NERO-like application with HyperNEAT- It 
could be interesting an=
d certainly it should be possible to raise the 
sensor resolution.  

The m=
ain question will be if NERO ends up benefiting from HyperNEAT.  
It may be=
 that regular NEAT is good enough to handle NERO effectively 
because NERO =
can be successful with only a few sensors.  Also, the 
main regularity in N=
ERO is left/right symmetry.  It is true that 
HyperNEAT may be able to expl=
oit this regularity better than regular 
NEAT, but with only afew sensors, =
the difference in performance may 
not be significant.

On the other hand, =
the difference could be significant especially 
considering that there are =
multiple types of sensors, i.e. friends, 
enemies, flags, walls, etc.  If t=
hey could be all cleverly placed on 
the substrate, it might lead to some n=
ice correlations.

ken

olution, in the

m will
